content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is a fun puzzle that is not too difficult in regular modes, but in reverse mode it introduces a bit more difficulty, but well-written tests help and puzzle in this mode is even more fun if you like reverse engineering.
maybe it is a bit too difficult for reverse

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Not too hard, not too easy. I feel like, you hit the sweet spot with this contribution :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: No doubt this is suitable for all modes of clash. Also more important is that this is friendly for beginners, I think.

Goal
* Please change "a matrix with digit" to "a matrix with digits".

* Please delete the brackets.

* Please change "changed to each other" to "swapped".

Input
* Please change "integers" to "space-separated integers".

* Please change "W digits in" to "Each line represents one row of the matrix with exactly [[W]] digits, chosen from".

Constraints
* Please change 0 to 1.

Thanks.
The description is updated. Thanks a lot!
Really? But all the rules can be found in the sample, I think. :)

the horizontal and vertical inversion could be found, but i think the swap between 6 and 9 is too complex to be found without any suggestion and it could make much more complicated to find the inversions

In fact, the inversion operation is equivalent to looking at the entire matrix upside down, so 6 and 9 will exchange each other. For example, consider the display of the nixie tubes for 2 and 5, which are actually still themselves upside down.
Thank you. ^_^
